content.text: Effective risk management is a systematic process of identifying, assessing, controlling, and monitoring potential threats to the school's ability to achieve its educational mission. This framework applies to all categories of risk: academic, operational, financial, reputational, regulatory, health and safety, safeguarding, and natural disasters.

content.title: Risk Categories
items: Academic Risks: Curriculum gaps, assessment malpractice, poor teaching quality, failure to meet standards, low enrollment.
Operational Risks: Facility failures, technology system failures, supply chain disruptions, contractor failures, transportation incidents.
Financial Risks: Budget shortfalls, fee collection difficulties, unexpected expenses, fraud.
Reputational Risks: Safeguarding incidents, academic integrity violations, negative media coverage.
Regulatory and Compliance Risks: Non-compliance with regulations, data protection breaches.
Health, Safety, and Security Risks: Natural disasters, fire hazards, medical emergencies, security threats.
Safeguarding Risks: Child abuse concerns, online safety threats, missing students.

steps.title: Identify the Risk
steps.desc: Clearly describe the risk event and its potential manifestations.

steps.title: Assess Likelihood
steps.desc: Consider historical data and local conditions.

steps.title: Assess Potential Impact
steps.desc: Consider worst-case scenarios across multiple dimensions.

steps.title: Identify Existing Controls
steps.desc: Document current measures that reduce likelihood or impact.

steps.title: Assess Residual Risk
steps.desc: Re-evaluate likelihood and impact considering existing controls.

steps.title: Determine Additional Mitigation
steps.desc: Identify further controls needed if residual risk is unacceptable.

content.text: The school risk register is a living document that records all identified risks, their assessments, control measures, ownership, and monitoring schedules.

content.title: Risk Register Template
items: Risk ID: Unique identifier.
Risk Category: From categories above.
Risk Description: Clear statement of the risk event.
Date Identified: When the risk was first added.
Risk Owner: Individual responsible for monitoring the risk.
Likelihood (Initial): Rating before controls.
Impact (Initial): Rating before controls.
Initial Risk Score: Likelihood × Impact.
Current Controls: Existing measures to prevent or mitigate the risk.
Likelihood (Residual): Rating with current controls.
Impact (Residual): Rating with current controls.
Residual Risk Score: Likelihood × Impact after controls.
Risk Status: Target, Tolerate, Treat, Transfer, Terminate.
Mitigation Actions: Additional measures needed.
Action Owner: Person responsible for implementing mitigation.
Target Completion: Deadline for mitigation actions.
Monitoring Frequency: How often risk is reviewed.
Last Reviewed: Date of most recent review.
Next Review: Date of next scheduled review.
Notes/Updates: Running log of changes.

content.text: While risk management aims to prevent crises, emergency response planning prepares the school to act effectively when incidents occur despite preventive measures.

content.title: Emergency Classifications and Response Levels
items: Level 1: Minor Incident - Localized event with minimal impact.
Level 2: Significant Incident - Event requiring coordinated response but not threatening life.
Level 3: Major Emergency - Serious event potentially affecting multiple people.
Level 4: Critical Crisis - Catastrophic event threatening life, requiring external emergency services.

steps.title: Incident Commander
steps.desc: Principal or senior leader assumes command.

steps.title: First Aid Officer
steps.desc: Assesses and provides emergency medical care.

steps.title: Security Coordinator
steps.desc: Secures campus perimeter and controls access.

steps.title: Student Support Coordinator
steps.desc: Provides psychological first aid to students.

steps.title: Documentation Officer
steps.desc: Documents timeline of events and evidence.

content.text: Effective evacuation depends on clear procedures practiced regularly through drills.

content.title: Evacuation Procedures and Assembly Points
items: Primary Assembly Points: Designated open areas away from buildings.
Secondary Assembly Points: Alternative locations if primary blocked.
Evacuation Roles: Teachers direct students, conduct roll call, report status.

content.text: Business continuity planning ensures that learning and essential school operations can continue or be rapidly restored after a disruption.

content.title: Critical Functions and Dependencies
items: Student Supervision and Safety: Staff, safe facilities, communication systems.
Teaching and Learning: Teachers, curriculum materials, learning spaces.
Assessment and Examinations: Exam materials, invigilators, secure storage.
Student Wellbeing and Safeguarding: Counseling staff, safeguarding procedures.
Communication with Parents and Stakeholders: Phone, email, SMS systems.

content.text: Identify which functions are essential to the school's mission and what they depend on.

content.title: Learning Continuity Scenarios and Plans
items: Scenario 1: Facility Closure - Assess facility damage and communicate with stakeholders.
Scenario 2: Staff Shortage - Adjust schedule and notify parents.
Scenario 3: Utilities Failure - Implement backup plans for power, water, and internet.

content.text: Off-campus activities and educational trips enrich learning but introduce additional risks. Rigorous risk assessment and approval processes are essential.

content.title: Trip and Activity Categories
items: Category A: Low Risk - Local, routine activities.
Category B: Medium Risk - Extended local or regular competitive events.
Category C: High Risk - Adventure, specialized, or international activities.

steps.title: Trip Details
steps.desc: Document trip title, purpose, date, destination, and participants.

steps.title: Hazard Identification
steps.desc: List all potential hazards associated with the trip.

steps.title: Risk Assessment for Each Hazard
steps.desc: Evaluate likelihood and impact for each identified hazard.

steps.title: Emergency Procedures
steps.desc: Outline emergency contacts, local services, and communication plans.
